'Rice yellow mottle virus (RYMV)' is a plant pathogenic virus, belonging to the
genus Sobemovirus. The genome is a positive-sense single strand RNA of 4450
nucleotides in length. It was first reported in Kenya in 1966, Bakker, W.
Characterization and ecological aspects of rice yellow mottle virus in Kenya.
1974. Plant diseases. and it has been detected in many countries in the
sub-Saharan Africa. Abo, M. E., A. A. Sy and M. D. Alegbejo. 1997. Rice
Yellow Mottle Virus (RYMV) in Africa: Evolution, Distribution, Economic
Significance on Sustainable Rice Production and Management Strategies. Journal
of Sustainable Agriculture. 11(2):85-111.
